page.title: 03Leavesden Aerodrome - RR.
page.content: The main product at Leavesden is the jet engine. There are 2512 people working there including 1500 engineers. They make different types of engines such as the RB199, RB211 and engines for military aircraft like the Tornado Swingwing. The workforce enjoy a wide range of sporting and social facilities and there are 2 banks and a supermarket on the site. The aerodrome has a main runway of 1089m and Decca 430 radar system with a range of up to 35 miles. The aerodrome is mainly used by small private aircraft owned by businesses as well as private individuals. The majority of flights by executives are made to other parts of Britain and also to European countries, especially France and Holland. Rolls Royce own the airfield. In July over a thousand redundancies were announced.
